greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A276156(n) - A002110(A007814(n)).
comment: A276156(n) converts the binary expansion of n to a number whose primorial base representation has the same digits of 0's and 1's, thus each one of its terms is a unique sum of distinct primorial numbers. This sequence is otherwise similar, but the primorial number corresponding to the least significant 1-bit of n is dropped from the sum, so the sum is not unique anymore.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: A276156(n) = { my(p=2,pr=1,s=0); while(n,if(n%2,s += pr); n >>= 1; pr *= p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 18 2019
